The inventor of the modern telegraph was Don Salvador, D. Coronado, a native of Spain, and director of the Madrid Observa- tory. He was at Paris when the first idea occurred to him, which he followed up with unremitting attention for four years, from 1786 to 1790. before he publicly announced it.
